title.rendered: Top 3 SEO Plugins for Optimization of a Website on WordPress

content.rendered:
SEO plugins come highly recommended when you aim to rank your WordPress website on Google or any other search engine. If you haven’t thought of such methods, it is never too late to implement plugins to rank higher in Google.

Even if you have laid down the proper groundwork, these plugins work parallel with your current digital marketing strategy and SEO services.

What is a WordPress Framework?

WordPress is a content management system (CMS) that allows you to build websites in addition to hosting them. It works alongside a set of plugins and templates to customize a certain website according to the business. In simple words, a website in WordPress is highly customizable and easier to rank than websites built on other frameworks.

WordPress is SEO-Friendly

That is one of the core reasons to choose WordPress over other frameworks. Why is a WordPress website SEO-friendly?

Content Addition – You can easily create content for the blog section and upload it to the website. Adding fresh content is a joy for search engines. Moreover, if the content boasts high quality, the chances to rank your blog section become higher.

Standard SEO-Friendly Attributes – The feature-centric WordPress platform carries custom permalinks, a neat site structure (no confusion in terms of adding and categorizing your products and/or services), and image optimization (i.e. alt tags).

Straightforward Code – The templates or themes you settle with usually have clean and SEO-friendly code. Some themes are better than others which means you have to be cautious when selecting a theme.

Let’s look at a few WordPress plugins to make the process of optimization fun and worth your time.

1. Yoast SEO

Any discussion of plugins for beginners includes Yoast SEO plugin as the key to ranking content. It is a crowd favorite when it comes to the list of WordPress SEO-friendly plugins. People all over the world strike it as the top plugin with 5-star reviews and ratings. Some of its strong features include –

  • Internal linking recommendations
  • Redirect manager (for 404 URLs)
  • Focus keyword analysis
  • XML sitemaps
  • Content and page run-throughs

Yoast checks the presence of important factors to help a page rank in Google. It is ideally suited to SEO beginners, providing them with the blueprint of SEO-friendliness of a webpage. Moreover, it includes a checklist of features like readability, word length, alt tags, focuses keyword suggestions, keyword density, title tags, Meta description, and outbound URLs to make a website rank better on search engines.

2. All in One SEO Pack

Again, this WordPress plugin is great for SEO beginners. Since 2007, All in One SEO Pack has had more than 45 million downloads and counting.

The plugin provides –

  • XML sitemap assistance
  • Google Accelerated Mobile Support (AMP) assistance
  • Google analytics backing
  • Redirect manager
  • Preset API
  • SEO incorporation on e-commerce portals like WooCommerce
  • Built-in Meta tags and title optimization
  • 6 SEO Tactics to Boost WordPress Websites

Once you acquire a bit of experience in the use of this plugin, you can create custom headlines, Meta titles and descriptions, and Meta keywords.

It is probably the best plugin to install for your WordPress website and as you mature as an SEO, you can make use of the power-user features to excel and do your A/B testing.

3. Premium SEO Pack

Exhibiting more than 24 qualities, Premium SEO Pack outperforms many SEO tools by a considerable margin. For a one-time payment of $44, you get –

  • Keyword analysis (up to 10 keywords in the basic package)
  • SEO suggestions and SEO page audit
  • Webpage SEO report and scores
  • Keyword recommendations
  • Custom Permalinks
  • W3C validator
  • Facebook post planner
  • 404 errors checks
  • Local SEO
  • Video sitemap
  • Mega optimization

Whether you are an SEO pro or a beginner running a WordPress website, this tool takes it to a level of optimization, Google and other search engines simply love. It may not be cheap, but it is full of features like image optimization, SERP analysis, and social media sharing option making it the go-to SEO plugin in 2019.

Install the light version to kick start things and use a limited number of functions. However, they should be enough to give you a preview of how the plugin operates.
